name: Salsa Ranchera
keywords: dried guajillo chilies, poblano pepper, gluten-free, vegan, vegetarian, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1/2 ounce dried guajillo chilies, stemmed and seeded
1 green poblano chili, roasted, stemmed, seeded and diced

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, just cover dried chilies with boiling water and let steep until tender, at least 30 minutes or up to 3 hours. Drain off and reserve soaking water. Purée chilies in a blender, adding soaking water as needed to make a smooth paste. Strain to remove skin bits and set aside.

In a pot, combine tomatoes, garlic, 1/2 cup onion, cumin and 2 tablespoons of guajillo purée. (Remainder can be refrigerated up to 1 week.) Add 1/2 cup water, bring to a simmer, and simmer until tomatoes collapse, about 10 minutes. Purée in a blender, then pour into a skillet.
Bring to a simmer and stir in remaining 1/4 cup chopped onion, diced poblano chili and salt to taste.
